newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian blue chips bounce back, more gains seen.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian blue chips bounce back, more gains seen.

text.p: Lithuanian blue chips bounced back in light trade on Friday and dealers said more gains were looming on the horizon.
The Litin A index clawed its way back over the 2,600 mark, edging up 43.47 points to 2,617.37 in central market trade worth 1.31 million litas.
The index is still a long way off its high in mid-January of 3,242.25.
Gainers included Lithuania Sea Shipping Company, which rose ten percent to 7.59 litas in trade of almost 114,000 litas.
The state-run company on Friday reported that its 1996 net profit was 55.8 million litas and that it would pay out a dividend of 16.5 million litas.
"That news may have pushed its price up today, but it probably won't go much higher," one dealer told Reuters.
Other gainers included Vilniaus Bank, which saw its ordinary shares advance 2.22 percent to 230 litas in trade volume of 11,500 litas.
The bank's shares had eased in mid-week despite its Monday announcement that its 1996 net profit had soared to 24.4 million litas from 2.9 million litas the previous year.
Rokishkis Cheese also shot up in strong demand, rising to 47.00 litas from 44.95 litas in turnover of 404,000 litas.
The company is considered to be one of the best managed in the country and is carving a niche for itself in overseas markets, making it look like a good buy, dealers said.
It has caught the eye of big league foreign investors like Williams de Broe, which bought a stake in it earlier this year.
Electronics components producer Vilniaus Vingis price was unchanged at 5.90 litas in trade of almost 50,000 litas but dealers said its price looked set to grow.
"One or two big shareholders want to sell their stake right now, so there is a big supply of its shares," said Arvydas Jacikevicius of brokerage firm Suprema.
"When those shares get sold, its price will probably go up quite a bit," he said.
Dealers also said that Hermis Bank's shares will probably rise when they are traded again. Trade in its shares has been suspended temporarily pending its general shareholders' meeting.
The bank reported on Thursday that its 1996 net profit had leapt to over 27 million litas after a loss of over eight million litas in 1995.
Block trades amounted to over 2.6 million litas.
